title: Trolls with Power. OP Legendari (NA)
body:
The percentage at which I'm encountering trolls is disgusting... I've lost most motivation to even bother playing, especially after the last month or so of the season where it was really bad. Team Builder is also a cesspool right now, due to the new map, where it used to be my favourite game mode for low-stress, troll-free games. I did one game tonight and it was all I could tolerate.

At the moment, I feel like the trolls have all the power and I believe that regular players are likely the ones getting punished for losing their temper, venting their frustration, etc... >We need some serious quality of life changes for season 5< to mitigate the negative impact that these people have on the game. Bring back the tribunal, implement vote-kicks in certain scenarios, address DCs/AFKs/ragequits. The problems are obvious, but nobody seems to be working on any solutions...

I love this post, it speaks alot of sense.

replies.body:
I've had a pretty bad experience of a troll where he played anivia which i first thought was just to steal my lane so i went adc and he proceeded to follow me into lane and try and wall me to get me killed and stop my backs. I definitely could've played better but this surely cannot be tolerated. Dealing with a DC or something similar is hard but this is just ridiculous

match: http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/87452534/200484908
It'd be great if something could be done about this, from what i heard in game some of them recognised the player and realised he was known for this kind of behaviour.

OCE bronze is pretty bad 
I am bad at the game, but i dont go afk or just buy wards only coz my fav champ was banned.
You say report a troll, they reply "no tribunal GG". Just taunting us. 
Try a surrender vote, 1 guys thinks he can carry, troll votes no and BAM stuck with the guy for another 20mins etc.

I doubt RIOT cares. Its been how long without tribunal now?

As they have said in many posts now, they are working on a new tribunal system that actually works.
I certainly hope that it does.
